title: Wonderful surgery
body:
I’ve chosen to leave a review because I’ve seen too many negative ones. I genuinely can’t fault the surgery. Both myself and my mum have been with other surgeries outside of the area and both agree this surgery is the best we have been to. 
Yes ok there’s a frustrated tone to the receptionists voice, but can you really blame them. I’m sure there’s a frustrated tone to my voice when I deal with people at work who ask me the same question constantly all day long. 
I don’t find them rude, there was a mix up with a prescription a while ago and they sorted it as a matter of urgency as I was 24 hours behind my medication. 
The ladies on reception deserve a medal having to deal with the tough times of covid! Give them a break

title: Flu clinic
body:
I brought my mum for her flu jab on 25th Sept and I wanted to say how wonderful the organisation and service was.
 One of your doctors came out to say good morning to those of us in the queue, one of your nurses was giving jabs to people who weren’t mobile - it was all so caringly and compassionately delivered. I feel so pleased my family are cared for by this practice. Thank you for all you do and importantly how you do it! Proper health CARE.

title: Thank you
body:
Flu jab.                Tick
Booster vaccine: Tick
In these difficult times, Both achieved with the minimum fuss, we say a Big Thank You to you all

title: Great Practice
body:
My 89-year-old father is registered with Willow Wood Surgery.  I often have cause to contact them.  Every time I do this, they always answer the telephone; act upon my requests such as prescriptions etc; and finally, do what they promise. All the staff I have had personal contact with are friendly and very helpful.

Yesterday I contacted the surgery as I was concerned about my father's health.  Within a few hours of speaking to a very nice lady at the surgery, my father received a home visit from a Nurse Practitioner.  

I couldn't have asked for better service and know my father is well cared for.  Thank you to all the staff at Willow Wood. I wish more GP practices were like you!

title: Great  practice
body: just had a blood pressure taken .It went very well  and on time the Nurse very helpful and friendly asking how I was  if I had any problems

title: Great doctor
body: Went today for my daughter's flu injection and she really didn't want to go at all. The doctor put her mind at ease straight away and cleverly distracted her, she was smiling throughout. The whole process was well organized.

title: incompetent
body:
gave details of a repeat perscription by letter and took it to the surgery,2 week later after 30 minute wait to get through to the surgery by phone i was told they couldnt find it , I had already phoned pharmacy to you and they hadnt recieved anything for me.
Thats why i had phoned the surgery. The recepionist told me i could pick up my prescription from the surgery 2 days later and i should ring them first. I rang as instructed ,and i was told it was there ,got to the surgery only to be told as it had been sent to pharmacy to you. I had then to go back home to ring pharmacy to you who was very helpful and give me a code to go and pick it up from a chemist .l am not a complainer and in the past i have recieved good service from the surgery but this has been an upsetting experience                  

ipip

title: Super efficiency
body: My husband and I received our flu jabs at St Chads church on Saturday 16th October. The whole procedure was highly efficient married to a great deal of warmth and caring from every member of staff we encountered. Nothing was too much trouble and smiley faces were in abundance. Thank you for everything you do for us. We are eternally grateful for your skills and care.

title: Highly recommend
body:
Helpful and friendly staff, even through pandemic have been able to see Doctor when needed and not felt rushed.
10/10

title: Great and Caring Team
body:
I have been so well supported by the team from doctors, nursing, dispensers and Admin staff. Had all investigations needed and really have felt supported through one of the most difficult couple of years of my life. 

I always feel listened too, they are the best GP practice I have ever been registered with. All are fabulous!

title: Poor Service
body:
Sadly you either cant get through on the day to get an appointment. or if you ring and state you have been advised to be seen asap by a GP you get the standard reply ring in the morning
no other advise they just want to get you off the call asap
just a poor service and at times rude and abrupt 
Some customer service training for them would not go a miss especially when you at all times try and lead by example when talking to them !

title: Amazing
body: I visited the minor injuries unit at Henley with my 20 month old today and the staff were beyond amazing. I cannot thank them enough for taking the time to make my son smile and laugh in an unfamiliar situation. Thank you to you both

title: Excellent treatment
body:
Visit to stepping hill today with brother with potential TIA. Brilliant treatment from check-in to discharge. Staff were very patient, thorough and helpful and kept us fully informed. Really excellent! 

5/5

title: My counsellor was amazing
body: I saw a member of the team for face to face counselling (I had to wait a long time due to being unable to use phone services) and the team member in question has been amazing, he was caring, kind and really engaged with me and learned all about me. I have high praise for this counsellor!

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Fantastic Service
body: I used e-consult. It is an easy form to complete and I had a response and a prescription at Boots an hour later. I was all sorted quicker than if I had tried to phone in for help.

title: Terrible doctors and even worse staff
body: Trying to get an appointment in this doctors is impossible ! And when you manage to get a phone appointment just as bad as I found my phone in my bag the phone had rang off. I rang the doctors to be told have to make another appointment as I have to go to work ! In the hospital not as lucky as the gps we have to still work I cannot make another appointment for a week as I cannot use my phone why at work. So this is another week of absolute agony

title: Superb department - very happy!
body: I arrived at the department for a endoscopy and colonoscopy procedure with a degree of apprehension not knowing quite what to expect! After a chat with one of the nurses, I opted for the throat spray and gas and air, and after being taken through to the procedure room and meeting the rest of the team, the procedures went very quickly with minimal discomfort. I would like to thank the whole team for their very friendly and caring help during the whole time. Without doubt this made the whole think much more relaxing than I could have ever hoped for! They're a credit to our wonderful NHS.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care
body: All the department and staff were fantastic. Thank you so much for the out standing care I received from various department

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great improvement to the phone service
body: I wanted to speak about the improvement to the phone service. We now have improved access to the surgery. I feel that I do mot have to worry about accesing health services when I am unwell. Well done all for sorting this.

title: Shocking service
body: I have been trying to get an appointment for my daughter for a week now. I phoned at 8am Wednesday Thursday and Friday last week with told no appointments and again in the afternoon with no success. Told sorry all appointments have gone today again. I was told to call 111 or go Hospital if emergency, its not an emergency but my daughter needs seeing in person is this difficult she is in pain.😕 We can't keep using covid-19 as an excuse. So tomorrow now I am clearly looking at a trip to a walk in centre which I shouldn't have to use as I am registered with a GP its a joke unhappy to say the least. Staff are so rude on reception as well which doesn't help.

title: Great job
body: Had my flu jab this morning, my appointment was 09:16 however I joined a queue when I arrived at 09:10. I was seen to and left the surgery at 09:40.  It took 25 mins from start to finish, no complaints from me (although I heard a lot whilst in the queue) - all the staff are doing an amazing job - so thank you to them all and keep up the good work.

title: Appalling service
body: After ringing to get an appointment for a boost jab for my husband, who has dementia,   was advised that he and my daughter had been removed from their register.  If I hadn't rung I would never have known

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: A little bit of improvement
body:
It’s a bit better with the new telephone system.
My question is: is there any arrangements for people who go to work 5 days a week from 8-4. I would appreciate your response. Many thanks

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent A & E
body: I would like to thank all the staff at A & E on Sunday 17th Oct21 right through to the nurse and doctor who quickly diagnosed and prescribed medication for my condition .The care was excellent and very much appreciated

title: Haven’t heard anything
body: I went for an ECG about ongoing heart issues, it came back clear but there was still something going on so i was sent a device and told to hand in my results by 8th of July, i emailed all my results to the hospital as requested and me nor my GP have heard anything back from the hospital despite me emailing several times, it’s really upsetting.

title: Great practice
body: We were very well looked after by the team since we registered in 2018. The support throughout the pandemic was superb both for long term and acute problems. No issues with appointments. They introduced a new digital consultation service which was very efficient, saved us wasting anyone's time for simple or even complicated problems. Ordering repeat prescriptions was straightforward and always successful. Our routine screening tests were also carried out successi. The vaccination rollout was great. We received initial doses with the vulnerable patients and were invited to receive the booster on time. The process was very well organized and delivered. I can not recommend this surgery enough. I want to thank all the doctors, the nurses, the support team who work in this surgery for everything they helped my family with. Thank you.

title: A Review About My Own Experience of 111 Callback
body:
I fractured a tooth during the morning of 17/10.
I self managed the pain initially, however it became acute by the afternoon of 18/10, and it was clear that I would need a dentist ASAP.  I am due to register with an NHS dentist in a few days (after a 7 week wait), but they wouldn't assist, and I was advised to contact NHS 111.  My initial enquiries with them began at 3.15pm by telephone. After 20 minutes wait I was stationery in a queue at position 10, and was showing little sign of progressing up the chain.
The 111 recorded message which looped every few minutes suggested completing the enquiry online, so I did that.
I was prepared for a lengthy delay for a call back (due to the interminable 'large volume of calls' situation), but I did get one from a nurse after just over an hour.
I was triaged at that point, and it was decided that my details would be passed to my area dental on call service, where I was once again triaged from a dental point of view. This resulted in my details being passed on to my local emergency health care centre, and I was triaged once more before being allocated an emergency dental appointment for 7.30pm.
Being triaged 3 times might be seen as being a bit of a bind, especially trying to speak with acute mouth pain, but I do get the rationale behind it. The NHS needed to ensure both mine and their staff's safety as regards to Covid, and they also needed to be 100% certain that I would get the right treatment, and they also needed to confirm that my pain was acute enough to require the emergency dental service. 
I have nothing but praise for the attention I received. I do get the numerous complaints from other service users, and they clearly highlight some areas where the NHS 111 service needs some rapid, and meaningful attention. 
However, my experience, despite being one I could have quite happily done without, was one that I wanted to highlight as being worthy of praise.
It took just over 4 hours from my initial call, to being sat in a dentist's chair having a tooth extracted.  
We are extremely fortunate to have the NHS, despite the 'beancounters' doing their best to run it into the ground.
Yes, it does have a lot of problems, but when the system works, it works well.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Phone line
body: Would just like to say how bad your phone lines are, I was in queue for 40 mins and then again for another 30. It’s just ridiculous other practices are not like this. You need to address it promptly

title: What A Joke
body: Never any appointments when you start ringing at 8am. The nurses and some, only some, of the admin are the saving grace for this practice. GPs, when you are lucky enough to get to talk to one, are blunt abrasive and generally obnoxious.

title: Poor service
body: Extremely disappointed with the surgery. I have been with a problem for over a year and there is lack of referrals. Comments like “I know it is frustrating” when you are in pain is not professional. The receptionist are not helpful either. They keep telling you to ring at 8 only to answers at 8.30 and again they ask you to call at 8. I would not recommend this surgery. My only option now is going to A&E.

title: No help
body:
Tried to get an appointment and can not get anything from them call in the morning or come in.
Never have I had such a bad experience as with this surgery

title: poor practice
body: i walked in after seeing a registered  sports therapist who diagnosed a possible compromised ankle joint. she ran ultrasound over it and it  told me to go to hospital as a i may have a fracture that needs confirming. At newton abbot hospital I was met with  dismissive male nurse practitioner who left me feeling belittled and gave me the impression he didn't want to know. I didn't get treated or have an xray i left feeling quite down. I know the NHS is busy but i didnt even get a look in. whats the point of having a local hospital if you are not going to treat the very poeple who pay for it.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Post pandemic worse
body: Since the pandemic, the service has gone downhill compared to previous. You call, your first in the call queue but it still takes a while to get through. No effort to see you when you've called frequently for your child when sick with a recurring cold, prescribe antibiotics for a child without a check up even after a negative PCR result. I cannot even forget the two times they have claimed to have left a message when no such thing happened. 1st time when child was sick again for the 10th time in the year and no one called me back at all. Until I called in the evening to be told callously by reception that the Dr is gone. And then recently when I booked a flu vacc for child but received no notification of the nurse being off sick until I arrive and wait for 15 minutes in the waiting room. Very slack service now and I now dread calling if my family genuinely need healthcare.

title: Satisfactory experience but it’s no guy t clear…
body: I took my 92 year old mother to the Oxford Centre for her Covid jab. We were told she must have the flu jab at the same time, which we weren’t happy with. The volunteer was polite and helpful, and talked to the supervisor who authorised the single jab. We did not want my mother to have two sore arms at the same time so had arranged the flu jab for a week later, by appointment, at her Swarland Avenue practice

title: Excellent Service
body: I am so pleased to be writing this review.  I had extremely efficient service from Wokingham Medical Centre today.   The telephone was answered by a friendly receptionist, and I received a call from a GP within 10 minutes and then invited in for an appointment that afternoon.  The GP was very kind and reassuring and I received a referral letter within a few hours.  Thank you very much to ALL the staff at Wokingham Medical Centre, your hard work is much appreciated.

title: Once again a great service
body:
1 needed confirmation of my Covid Booster which is not on the NHS App. I rang the practice (I was second in the Queue) and got emailed confirmation within 5 minutes.
Thank you

title: very quick appointment
body:
the appointment was very quick and got the consultation within days, 
surgery booked within weeks and all the staff was wonderful

title: Brilliant!
body: I cannot believe the negative comments on here. I left my previous GP surgery because they only employed locums. I never ever saw the same GP more than once. I wanted to return to a proper, family run GP surgery and, through recommendations, I registered with 306. I have not experienced anything negative so far. The receptionists are friendly, the pharmacist is approachable. I can only assume the negative comments are from people who really don't know what a bad GP surgery is. If you have a problem with visiting a proper GP surgery, DM me and I'll point you in the direction of bad ones. The best decision in my life was joining this surgery. And no, I'm not related, nor been paid for this comment.

title: Extremely caring staff
body:
I have been to the Endoscopy unit before.  Today was no different as the staff were very friendly and caring.  Treated me with every consideration.
I cannot praise them high enough.  Anyone being referred to this dept, should have no worries about being sent there.

I hope all my future endoscopies are carried out by the staff here.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Minor injuries
body:
I attended the walk in because of a back injury I sustained in the morning.
I read on the site that Accrington Victoria specialises in back issues. 
I was seen swiftly in triage.  I took the paracetamol offered to me because I don't get much for free.
 I felt like I was a hindrance to them. 
I was told immediately that they do not x-ray backs. I could go to Blackburn but I couldn't be guaranteed one there either. 
Utter waste of my time and theirs.
I have come away dissapointed in the NHS 
There is even less of a chance of being seen by a gp too, so what is the next step with a minor injury that is not the ankle or wrist? 
Maybe overdose on painkillers obtained from the internet.
Or phone for an ambulance to get admitted.
I understand why this happens now. 
Meanwhile I am in agony.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: The best service, how to see a GP quickly and in…
body: I was delighted to discover that the practice is now seeing patients face to face again and that the walk in morning clinic is now open. I have always known how lucky we are to have this service and it has been much missed during Covid. Phone calls and photos are no substitute for seeing a doctor and it feels such a relief to see someone again.

title: Wonderful Practice
body: All the staff from the receptionist to the Nurses and Doctors give a wonderful experience You dont feel rushed and if you just have a question to ask nothing is to much trouble

title: Terrible doctors and even worse staff
body: Trying to get an appointment in this doctors is impossible ! And when you manage to get a phone appointment just as bad as I found my phone in my bag the phone had rang off. I rang the doctors to be told have to make another appointment as I have to go to work ! In the hospital not as lucky as the gps we have to still work I cannot make another appointment for a week as I cannot use my phone why at work. So this is another week of absolute agony

title: Great practice
body: Dr's and nurses are helpful and are trying their best even though they are under more pressure then usual with everything that's going on with the pandemic. Great surgery!

title: 3 weeks of trying and still answer phone!!
body: I’ve been trying to book an appointment for over 3 weeks and every single time I ring, no matter the time of day I get an answer machine message telling me to call back later. I work full time and cannot ‘pop in’. The service was appalling before COVID and now I cannot even get through to speak to anyone! Fail to send letters out for routine cervical cancer tests, routine appointments, tell me they cannot help with a child development centre referral that the doctors don’t do it!! It is appalling, stressful and needs to be resolved.

title: Very happy
body: After receiving a call from school re my child and some unusual symptoms I phoned the practice and found myself 20th in the queue. Regardless of this within 15 mins my call was answered by a warm receptionist (who must have been answering calls relentlessly) I described my daughter symptoms and was asked to bring her straight down. 10 mins later we were in the waiting area and seen 5 mins later. At such a worrying time we were seen quickly. I really feel sorry for practices at the moment with all the media when actually you all continue to serve us as you always have under extreme pressure and still delivering the service we all need. thank you Reception and clinical staff

title: Can’t get through to book appointment
body: I have tried several times to get this surgery to answer my call, I understand they are busy but waiting in a queue several times for more than 30mins and still no answer! Very frustrating. I went into the surgery to book an appointment for my flu vaccination only to be told you can only do this over the phone!!

author: The Blacksmith
title: High Grade Bladder Cancer
body:
Having passed blood in my urine (just once), I got a bit of a fright and contacted my GP, who immediately asked me to bring a sample. Within one week I had an ultrasound in Stirling Health & Care Village, which was followed up with a flexible cystoscopy at Forth Valley Royal Hospital by the most amazing Urology Nurse Specialist, Leanne , who identified a tumour and offered spectacularly good care managing the shock of cancer. I was in the Care of Mr. Tweedle and his staff for a Trans Urethral Resection of a bladder tumour (TURBT) procedure and chemotherapy only two weeks later. Pathology news was again delivered by Leanne with care and consideration indicating I had a high grade tumour and would need further procedures. I had a second TURBT procedure six weeks later under the Care of Mr. McIlhenny and I am please to say Leanne was able to offer good news with pathology this time around as the tumour had been removed in its entirety. Next stage for me is immunotherapy with the BCG vaccine.  
I have gone from having little interaction with the NHS beyond local GP led care to having undergone an Ultrasound scan, a flexible cystoscopy. two TURBT procedures, two epidurals, chemotherapy a CT scan and chest x-ray, all within three months.  
I now have a care package which includes 3 years of immunotherapy, 5 years of CT scans and 10 years of cystoscopy surveillance. I cannot fathom the cost to our NHS for my care. It is clear the NHS is incredible value for money.  
Having gotten in to my fifties with no invasive procedures to then have the shock that I would be getting a camera and surgical tools pushed through the relatively small hole of my urethra filled me with dread. The reality was quite the opposite, I encountered the most considerate and caring professionals I could ever have hoped for. I had the absolute treat of being able to watch my tumour being resected "live" as I had a spinal and was awake throughout the procedure! At every touch point the care was exceptional from Consultants, Anesthetists, Practitioners, Nurses, Auxiliaries and support staff. Interestingly I though my tumour would be dark and sinister but it proved to be quite pretty a bit like a sea anemone. My wife named my tumour Twoey (Audrey II) after the main protagonist in the "Little Shop of Horrors" musical, an alien with a need for human blood. This really helped manage the mental stress of the "C" word in a typically disparaging Scottish way.  
I have nothing but praise for the staff and the Institution of Forth Valley NHS, and if truth be tole have a bit of a man crush on the consultant urologists, I am in absolute awe at the skills needed to conduct a procedure, through my urethra to remove a cancerous tumour. It may seem a bit incredulous that I am looking forward to immunotherapy but the fact is I have a high grade cancer which has been caught early and with immunotherapy the chances of keeping my bladder are very good, and I must say I am pretty fond of by bladder. I am now in receipt of the best care and surveillance possible for the next 10 years.  
The NHS may be used as a political football, but when push come to shove the NHS is always there as the cornerstone of society, looking after all of us in our time of need.  
Thankyou so much to all the staff at Forth Valley Royal Hospital for your spectacular care and to the institution of the NHS. I know Scotland had a tradition of health care before Nye Bevan's formation of the NHS, but the NHS should be treasured for all the good it does.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Robbiedino
title: A recent visit
body: Visited surgery ,met with Dr Don ,received excellent service was ,referred to homerton hospital for tests. I appreciate the concern by the doctor and all the staff at lower Clapton surgery who make my visit to there such an easy job thank you.

author: flutenx77
title: Trolley beds in A&E are to small for a 6FT man
body:
I was admitted to A&E via ambulance. The paramedics were a great team and worked well together. The staff in A&E took good care of me but the  
trolley beds are too small for a 6ft man. The male nurse got me hospital bed  
which was a lot more comfortable.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dreadful: refusal of basics
body:
Been fighting this surgery for around a year, because they refuse to provide me with enough insulin needles.  Can anyone actually believe this!?

It has got to the point where they have agreed, each time but only after the fact, forcing me to get a second script every single month.  

I get my diabetic consultant to write them a letter, to tell them to provide the needles, it actually takes that.  Today they claim to have not received the letter, the letter I have, as it was also sent to me, with me being ccd in 

I'm actually even more angry now than before, not because they are disputing an instruction from a consultant, so much as they are formally now arguing the toss over needles.  

What kind of sick joke is this!?

How exactly do they expect me to take insulin?  

Do they think everything is fine and I don't need insulin?  Or do they think I should just give it a miss some days? Can someone just confirm what country this is again?  

I obviously must have something wrong.

author: blackbirdbg58
title: all staff are brilliant
body:
I had a fall at the GP surgery and was transferred to A&E. I was seen straight away and the staff completed a full examination including x-rays, CT scans. I was well looked after but when the Doctor was talking to me I found it very hard to hear him due to other staff talking very loudly outside my bay. I also think that A&E should allowed patients to be accompanied as I was in shock and slightly terrified after my fall and it was hard to take everything in. The doctor was very kind and he called my daughter to explain as I knew I wouldn’t have remembered everything.  
I was then moved to male medical and the staff here are brilliant. All the staff from the nurses, HCA’s catering, domestics and Doctors are very friendly and caring. The nurses in this ward call my daughter regularly with an update which is good as she cannot visit and she would be worried otherwise. The physio’s have been helping me get back on my feet again and they are very encouraging and I can feel my confidence building every day. The food is lovely and always hot, everything is to my taste. The cleaners do a fantastic job and never seem to stop, they leave no spot untouched.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: KimCK
title: Induction and Birth of Daughter - staff amazing at their jobs
body:
Was scheduled to be induced on Saturday due to having Polyhydramnios (too much amniotic fluid)  
I didn’t receive a call to go in as scheduled as Labour ward was extremely busy. Received a call on Sunday evening asking me to come in as they now had space on the ward for me. I was welcomed straight away by my amazing midwife Sophie. Made to feel completely relaxed and at ease. Every step was explained fully. It all started off smoothly then I had a few complications due to my daughter being stressed with contractions and moving from pelvis. I can not fault the care I received from whole midwife and doctor team in the Labour ward, they acted quick and again I was made aware of exactly what was happening at all times. The care I received from Sharon who also helped during my sons birth 15 months previously was also exactly what myself and daughter needed and I believe it was her care and experience that helped me avoid needing an emergency Caesarean.  
For the remainder of my Labour I was supported and helped by Sophie - I honestly don’t think I could of done it without her help. The staff at Aberdeen Maternity Labour ward are amazing at there job. I have had 2 very different birth experiences in this ward now - spontaneous birth and also a planned induction. Both times the staff have been great and I have been treated with kindness and support throughout. Can’t thank the staff here enough - they truly are amazing at there jobs!

author: outflowrg96
title: Impressive communication between all staff and hospitals
body:
I have been in this ward for about 10 days and I am so impressed with the care provided. The staff work together as a team and would go above and beyond to meet their patient’s needs. As a long term patient I find the meal choice repetitive. I do wish there was a gravy option on the menu as the meals can be dry at times.  
The domestics clean to a very high standard and are friendly. I have attended the Royal whilst being in this ward and both hospitals have been working together so everything runs smoothly, the communication between both hospitals has been superb. The T.V in the bay is very small and there is not enough remote controls in the ward so each bay is borrowing the remote but don’t bring it back.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mindfulness55
title: Waiting time and lack of communication
body:
I sustained a fractured wrist one week ago and currently I am awaiting surgery. I was put on a stand by list and told on Friday evening to fast in preparation for surgery on Saturday.  
I was contacted twice throughout the day(Saturday) and advised surgery was still planned to go ahead. Then had further contact by the team mid afternoon advising that surgery would now not take place that day and that a member of the team would contact me on Sunday evening with the likely event that surgery would take place on Monday.  
No contact was made by anyone on Sunday evening so therefore I fasted in preparation for surgery on Monday but still had no communication regarding any planned surgery. I had no information of who to contact to discuss so therefore had to make contact through the fracture clinic at Hairmyres Hospital to be put in touch with the trauma liaison team WGH where I spoke with charge nurse who told me that contact would be made later in the day when the theatre list had been prepared for the next day. I went on to make a further telephone call that evening as I still had received no communication and was told again at that time that there would be contact made when the theatre list had been prepared. I was later contacted by a nurse who advised me that there was no plan for my surgery the next day and that they were unable to confirm when this would take place and that it was a case of waiting on them making contact the night before when they would advise me to fast, this could be 2 days away.  
I felt let down, extremely anxious and unsure where to turn for help.  
I myself work for the NHS and given the current staffing shortage I would have thought that a valuable staff member being treated in a timely manner allowing me to recover and return to work sooner would be beneficial to NHS Lanarkshire.  
As an NHS nurse I am disappointed to see the poor communication to a patient suffering from the distress and pain of a traumatic accident with no indication after a week as to when treatment might be given. I feel better communication would help reduce patient anxiety and distress.  
[Unsure about 'Treatment']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Happychap1
title: Prompt and kind treatment
body: My daughter was seen promptly and sent for X-ray direct from triage by a lovely minor injuries sister. X-ray taken and reviewed very efficiently by Claire and a lovely Dr Ruth. Expert explanation and lovely manner with my daughter. A credit in an obviously busy department.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Nochance
title: My treatment has been second to none.
body:
I have just spent two weeks in Ward 4. My treatment has been second to none from the doctors down to the auxiliary workers. Everybody has been both professional and very friendly.  
Thank you sincerely.

readBy.name: Office of Christine Grahame, MSP for Midlothian South, Tweeddale and Lauderdale
Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Jo1992
title: Diabetes consultant Covid vaccination
body:
Wow where do I start with my experience. I attended the gestational diabetes clinic, the appointment started off well , but I felt ended on a very sour note. I felt the two doctors I seen lectured me about why I should have the Covid vaccine. In my opinion they were using scare tac ticks to do so. I had spoken to my community Midwife previously and she had advised me against it, but now all of a sudden I'm told it’s perfectly safe. The consultant could have at least waited before I fully closed to door before making his rude comments. I am sick of the feeling of being pushed from pillar to post. Supporting mother’s to be, I don't feel supported. I feel there's a lack of support and feel some of my concerns are dismissed.  
I had preeclampsia with my first son and was continually dismissed until late into my pregnancy and ended up in a hypertensive state before my son was delivered. Nearly costing us both our lives and lack of communication is the answer i was given for why it happened. I had to sort my own scan appointment today as the wrong date was given. I was also told I would be having extra observations and scans, however 36 weeks is when it’s been deemed appropriate to check my baby. in my opinion this is disgusting service.

author: a.kng
title: Children's ward stay
body:
I recently had a 9 day stay on the childrens ward at Forth Valley Royal hospital with my 6 week old son who contracted RSV which developed to bronchiolitis and badly effected his breathing. All of the staff from the domestics, nurses and doctors showed such empathy, kindness and support and made a terrifying experience as a parent, so much easier to process. I could see how busy the ward was during our stay but I never once felt that my son was not a priority and any buzzer calls were answered with a smile (even my multiple calls for trips to the stereliser!).  
All of the nurses involved in my sons care were fantastic and I can't fault any of the staff, however there were a few that I feel deserve particular recognition including Sharon, Jackie and Alison. Sharon was an absolute hero during our time in the hospital and really made sure my husband and I knew what was going on and why and showed such care to our son that we always felt in safe hands. Sharon has a lovely nature and you can tell she loves her job. I've never seen someone juggle as much as she did and never made us feel like a burden. We will forever be grateful for Sharon. Jackie similarly was our night shift star and was so on the ball and gentle with our son but also to a sleep deprived and worried parent, bringing tea and checking I had everything I needed. Jackie kept me going through the tough nights and she really does prove that nursing is a calling and she is so great at it. Alison again showed such care to our family and reguarly popped her head in to check how we were doing and offer words of reasurrance, even though she was not directly in charge of our care. The paediatric doctors, Sophie and Dr Watson, were also very thorough in their care and Sophie particularly had such a kind, caring and gentle mannerism when assessing our son and was very patient with any questions we had.  
The NHS has been a tough place to work, particularly over the last few years, but the childrens ward staff are an excellent example of how great our NHS staff are and I can't thank the ward and all the staff enough.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: I Never Complained
title: Thanks to All of the Staff
body: I was recovering from an aaa operation. Thanks to All of the Staff at the High Dependency Unit at the Royal Infirmary, Edinburgh. Particularly Hollie who seemed to be there for me every day throughout my stay. Thanks to Mr. Falah and for their skill and dedication in getting me through a long and difficult time in theatre. Everyone at the HDU, You are All Angels.

author: deltapb97
title: Implant removal
body:
After having my contraceptive implant fitted almost a year ago, my periods became more frequent and lasted for around three weeks and in the fourth week I had constant spotting, so I wanted the implant removed. Having called in September and being told it would be an 18 week wait to see a doctor with no guarantee that they would agree to take it out I was very apprehensive.  
When I arrived at the clinic, I felt I wasn’t greated with compassion and care by the receptionists instead, I was met with blunt responses. I was sat in a waiting room, unable to use the toilet, whilst they were whispering behind a desk. However, when the doctor arrived to collect me, he was polite and chatty and made me feel at ease. The nurse and doctor were kind and couldn’t have done much more to make the process any easier. My implant was stuck and took a while to remove but, the nurse was very caring, cleared my wound and checked if I was okay afterwards.

author: Maggie M
title: The Royal Alexander Hospital In Paisley. Ongoing nightmare
body:
In March 2020 l attended the Royal Alexandra Hospital in Paisley. Right at the time visitors were stopped from seeing their loved ones due to Covid.  
I was admitted for an "exploratory" on my bowel after a CT scan at another hospital showed a problem. It has only taken them (the NHS) nearly 60 years for my lifelong "Colic" issue to finally be taken seriously. I now have an ileostomy. I woke up the next morning after my exploratory with an ileostomy, a bag, a "stoma". To be quite honest 1000 characters is by no way means enough to even start with my complaints about my treatment at this hospital and it's staff. I swear l don't even know where to begin to start to tell you about this place. The care (or lack of therein) I received from the nurses, to the wards, to my surgery, to my surgeon to my after care nurse ...my supposed "5 day hospital stay"... that ended up an 18 day stay due to the surgeon's mistakes and then a truly horrendous infection due to my aftercare (again... or lack of)... to trying to get help, answers, diagnosis and finally... how to go about getting another surgeon who will do a reversal on my ileostomy as my surgeon is not willing to do one...  
l was told that after 12 months l could have a reversal. Goal posts have been changed due to... yes, you guessed it, Covid. I feel like COVID has been their excuse for everything. Im now 19 months down the line...my surgeon keeps changing the goal-posts. My ileostomy nurse refuses to contact me and in the one recent email when l contacted them with a problem, the response back was one sentence, saying to ask my GP for an urgent referral.l have basically been left on my own, left to my own devices. Left to try and figure out where to get answers. Left to deal with this lifechanging ileostomy with no backup. No aftercare. No helpline. No apology for a lifetime being told l had "colic" only to be informed recently by my GP "you do realise that you were misdiagnosed as having colic when your whole life it indeed appears you had Crohn's disease" ?? Where do l start ? I can count on one hand on how many times l have left my home in the last 19 months...leaving your home with a stoma is a nightmare for obvious reasons.Finally...For three years of my life from 2006 to 2009 l was misdiagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. I was told by the oncologist at the time l had a "fatty lump"...l survived that with very little help from those professionals.Thank god for the AMAZING Beatson cancer hospital in Glagow. As you have probably gathered...l'm ever so slightly bitter and twisted about my experiences.I will not go any further...but l probably think you get the gist ??Thank you for reading

title: feedback
body: the staff are very nice and the doctors are helpful. maybe some books and toys in the waiting area would be good for kids if the pt has to wait to be seen

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Safari dreamer
title: friendly and caring team
body: The Endoscopy Team at North Devon Hospital demonstrate exactly why we should appreciate and value our NHS. A wonderful team of people who make you feel as though you are the only patient in the hospital, a friendly and caring team who made the difference whilst I underwent a gastroscopy. Thank you Tanja, Sheree, Jo, Rachel, Sue, Martin and the reception staff whose names I didn't catch, you can all be immensely proud of your work and your efforts to put patients at ease.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: estevie
title: Centre of Pain Education (COPE), my lifeline
body: I've been receiving help from COPE for the last 5 or 6 years and found that the staff are everything you'd want from medical professionals, what sets them apart from other services is that they are extremely pro-active and they will go out of their way to provide the best possible care available whether it be referrals or advise on various other options. They are a lifeline which I'm very grateful for.

title: Excellent admin staff
body: Very kind staff members, spoke to a gentleman on the phone who called regarding the flu jab and also explained to me how it helps us. He was very knowledgeable and kind. Amazing

author: festivitycg44
title: compassionate care provided by all staff
body:
I came to A&E due to chest pain and I was seen straight away. The staff in A&E are excellent and very attentive. I was then moved to CCU the staff are fabulous. All the staff show compassion and give some love in their care which means a lot when in hospital. The tea is plentiful and always hot.  
The HCA Joanne today is very friendly and seems to go above and beyond. It small things like this that make a difference. The dinner is brilliant and the hot and cold side on the trays is a genius idea. The ward has a good routine at morning and night and even meal times. The doctors explain everything on my level and don’t come across condescending as they are medically trained and I am not.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful practice
body: We've been with the practice since 1984. We've always found the teams to be caring and attentive. Covid has been difficult for all care providers however the service in my families view has remained excellent throughout and we couldn't wish for better care. Thank you all.

title: Amazing Practice made of lovely people
body:
Always had sincere kind help from reception staff. 

They make it so easy for you when your ill.

I hope that never changes at Albert Road Surgery. 

Thank you to all at the reception!

author: scottishorganist
title: Excellent help from Out of hours GP.
body: I had been feeling quite poorly for several days. I attended A&E as GP surgery unable/unwilling to see me due to cough, temperature and loss of taste. A&E Dr was thorough and diagnosed toncillitis and prescribed Phenoxymethylpenicillin. Five days later my symtoms were worsening and throat now white/creamy, not red. I saw a locum GP at my local surgery, who spent all of five and a half minutes with me, it felt they had no time for me and told me to leave. I was shocked. I went directly to my local pharmacy and the staff there were excellent and extremely supportive, suggesting I contact NHS111 out of hours after 6pm. This I did, thankfully, as I was seen by an extremely professional, caring, wise Dr Coates, who took twenty five minutes with me and diagnosed a bronchial spasm/infection, toncillitis and respiratory issues, and handed me all the necessary medication. This is the next day and I already am feeling brighter, much, much less coughing and wheezing. Thank you Dr Coates. In my opinion, you have to be recognised for your exceptional level of patient care. Thank you most sincerely.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: feedback
body: great reception team, nurses and pharmacist also great. Have regular GPs and fewer locums

author: sierraqd93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Help from my Community Nurse
body:
I was experiencing some anxiety and was also having times when I was having angry outbursts. Annie really helped me with these, showing me ways to calm down. Annie gave me some breathing exercises to do and these have been really helpful.  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
Annie was great, and really listened to me. I was sad when she had to discharge me but I know if things are difficult again in the future I know how to make a re-referral.  
Thank you Annie!

author: Whiskey22
title: Mental health
body: I feel that my Dr's and psychiatrist both think because I have been ill for so long that they now don't take into consideration my other health issues as they did before. In my opinion it feels like I am telling lies and I don't get treated regarding my health problems.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: General running of practice
body:
I & my family have been patients at this practice for approximately 30 years. The practice management changed and we were never informed of this. Telephone numbers were changed which we only found out from another family member. I believe it would have been more patient focused to inform us by either a letter, email or telephone call. I don’t think that is unrealistic.
Since becoming matrix medical the service has declined rapidly. I have no idea who my named GP is and when given appointments prior to COVID-19 I never saw the same GP twice. 
Since COVID-19 the doors to the practice are closed. I have been spoken to through a crack in the door on several occasions and conducted any conversations on the street which I find personally unacceptable I work within the NHS and would never treat my patients in this way.
The telephone lines are permanently busy. I understand that demand has increased but find it difficult to see how as in a reply to a previous complaint you say that your GPS are seeing more patients than before.
On the web site for your practice it states use e consult, when you enter the link this is not available. Why advertise this service?

Regards 

Anonymous

author: Doodledame
title: Spinal Surgery
body:
I had spinal surgery at Southampton Neuro Centre, University Hospital on Thursday 14th October performed by Mr N Brooke.  
Although the surgery had been delayed 5 times due to pressures at the hospital, it went well. I had superb care from all the medics & staff i came into contact with from Day Surgery Ward, Recovery Room, Surgical HDU & Ward F4, I couldn't fault any of them as they were all so caring & attentive. I did so well that I was discharged just 48 hours after surgery. The atmosphere in the hospital was very positive & far better than another local hospital when I had been an inpatient for 5 days, I was amazed at the difference between them.

author: tangowd79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Acute Oncology Service
body: I contacted Seamoor after side effects from a new drug. It wasn't an urgent enquiry but it was a Friday afternoon. I really wanted advice before the weekend. They were as usual very busy. I was phoned back and reassured. Indeed I was also promised a call on Saturday to check all was well and this was done. I would like patients to know that my experience of the Seamoor staff has been excellent. My enquiries/concerns have always been treated with great kindness and professionalism. Wonderful, dedicated staff, thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: DevonBoy
title: Comfortable process for CT guided lung biopsy
body: I had to have a biopsy taken from my lung, I was made at ease by the doctor and nursing staff and the whole process was very comfortable.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: BAD
body:
No patient care at all. Your just a number on a computer.  Never get follow up. Never get to see same go for continuity.  Get msg to book appointments but when you ring they are only dealing with emergency calls. Got 100% worse since modality took over. No wonder A & E depts are sinking. 
Also have COPD but no one offers any help or support from this practice any more

title: What a mistake
body:
I went to register myself as a local resident.
The door is shut, have to use intercom , after few minutes , some rude person asking impolitely, what do you want? , after lots of irrelevant information , she opened the first set of doors, found myself inbetween 2 sets of doors , had to knock on the second set of doors to open, one really impolite receptionist passed a form from a slot in big wall around her area.
Go fill it and drop it in a box outside the building, she said.
Can i sit on a chair and fill it in reception? No she said.
We do not allow anyone in
I asked why?
Because of the covid19
At this stage, i lost confidence in doctors with such an attitude and impolite staff even before handing them the responsibility for my life.
I handed back the form and left .
My question is where is the CQC and the CCG quality team to investigate this behaviour and attitude.

author: Doubleflemish
title: First class service at Moorfields Eye Hospital
body:
I arrived as requested 15 minutes earlier than my 10:00am appointment and joined the back of the queue that was shuffling up the ramp. For some reason some people marched straight up the ramp and past the queue and they were turned back by the man at the top, except for those in wheelchairs who appear to have priority.  
When it was my turn I was told Clinic 11 was on the lower ground floor and was allowed in. Just inside the entrance a lady insisted I wash my hands with sanitiser and wear a new mask, both products were provided. I couldn't find the stairs so used a lift to go down one floor into Clinic 11 and reported to reception without a queue - there were about 6 other patients waiting that I could see  
Within a few minutes I was called for a sight and pressure test and given eye drops. 5 minutes later I was called for examination and the doctor realised he had called me too early so I was sent back to wait. After I was recalled my eyes were thoroughly and efficiently examined with the doctor telling me at all times what he was doing and why.  
I was told the results, thankfully nothing that serious and given advice on what action to take should further symptoms manifest.  
I was in and out in 40 minutes. I am most pleased with how I was treated. From my experience today I would say Moorfields functions as a well-oiled machine that gives 1st class service.

author: Elo810
title: Hysteroscopy Under General Anaesthetic
body:
I was referred for an Outpatient Hysteroscopy after a somewhat concerning ultrasound.  
Thankfully, I did a bit of research beforehand and found that despite hospital paperwork saying it would feel like period pains, most women do actually find it horrendously uncomfortable and painful. Knowing I have awful periods already, I knew going in that I would not be allowing myself to have this without adequate pain relief.  
The nurses were lovely and the consultant explained what would happen, however there was no mention of pain relief. It was at this time that I requested a General Anesthetic for the procedure and it was instantly agreed by the consultant, without question, which I am hugely thankful for.  
Roll on a week and a half and I’m waiting to go into theatre. Again, the nurses were fantastic and do their best to put you at ease, however I was still very anxious. I was given a sedative prior to the main anaesthetic and it helped so much in making the whole thing better.  
I woke up what seemed like two minutes later and this is where I feel the care went downhill, sadly.  
I had told the anaesthetist prior to going in, that I suffer with horrendous sickness after anaesthetic and he assured me I would be given an anti-sickness medication to stop this.  
Unfortunately, I was still very unwell after and couldn’t even keep water down for a couple of hours. Despite this, I was advised by a nurse that I needed to eat so that I could be discharged, as I’d already been there for ages.  
I was also in awful pain from the procedure and asked for painkillers and I was brought Codeine. I explained that this usually makes me feel very nauseous and so I would prefer something else as I was already feeling very sick. I was told that I’d already had paracetamol, so couldn’t have anything else - surely Ibuprofen would have been readily available in a hospital setting? And so I was left to ride out the pain until it eased slightly.  
Up until I woke up, the care was brilliant, but the aftercare was a let down. Despite this, I am very happy I was able to have a General, I know I absolutely would not have been able to do it as an Outpatient appointment and so please do push for this if this is what you want!

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: pavoxg37
title: Great service
body:
I was recently diagnosed with hemochromatosis and my treatment would involve venesection appointments every 2 weeks.  
Given typical experience of healthcare provision, I had low expectations of what the venesection service would be like. For example, I was anticipating it would be difficult to find a suitable appointment (to fit around work and family), appointments would involved hours of waiting around and may be cancelled at short notice.  
I have been delighted with the actual service provided at Day Medicine in NHS Forth Valley. There is a dedicated venesection clinic where it is easy to find a suitable appointment, it runs on time and is very quick and easy. The staff have been very friendly, helpful and professional. Thank you to both Nancy and Catherine for providing an excellent service.

author: MSEV
title: Good service from gynaecology
body: I have had very good service from above departments at GDH and Lincoln Hospital starting from April 2020, the staff have all been very friendly and informative putting me at ease, during a a very stressful time at the beginning of my treatment. Thank you Gynae.

title: Terrible practice
body: Need a routine appointment for husband who works nights. He stayed up to ring at 8am and make an appointment, rang 130 times in 20 minutes and gave up. My daughter rang around lunchtime to follow up on results for tests, got into number 19 in the queue. Got to front of queue and connected, held for 40 minutes and while still on hold rang from another number at which point found out everyone had gone to lunch and just left people dialling-in floating in the ether. Terrible service. Not sure how to book all these wonderful and convenient extra appt slots nhs website advises are being made available, as impossible to get through. Personally will ring 111 so they can tell me i need an appointment, which i now urgently require. Due to familys issues getting through i hoped wouldnt need treatment from surgery its not possible to book with

title: You literally cannot get an appointment
body:
This is my 2nd time doing the e consult thing and no one actually has gotten back to me even though I got an email saying I will be contacted through email or phone before a certain time. Nothing happen. No call, no email. 
It’s so difficult to get an appointment there or even get in touch with anyone. I would not recommend this practise to my worst enemy.

title: Bit of a wait but excellent care
body: Had to wait best part of 4hrs for treatment but they were very busy so understandable. Staff excellent and even got a cup of coffee and biscuit

author: Patient Minor injuries unit
title: Lengthy wait for vulnerable elderly at vaccination centre
body:
My mum - in her 80’s- had to have her appointment for Covid booster and flu jab rescheduled from her Health Centre due to illness. No appointments available in any health centre in Livingston so I took her to the Vaccination centre Pyramids Business park today.  
Thanks to the Porter who provided us with a wheelchair when I asked as she was unable to stand for the 1 hour 20 mins she had to wait beyond her appointment time. The majority of others attending were similiarly vulnerable elderly and for example on crutches, with mobility aids or struggling with continued standing as there were no chairs in the long winding queue for at least the first hour.  
The gentleman next to us in the queue was immune compromised whilst nearby elderly lady very worried at leaving her relative who needs care at home on their own for such an unexpectedly long time. Meantime drop in’s - younger age group attending for first or second jabs- were being fast tracked through and although fit enough to be able to queue were going straight to the front, jabbed and out. We queued for over an hour before we heard that drop ins were to be stopped.  
I fully appreciate the drive and need to get folks immunised for Covid including younger age groups and the challenges inherent to managing groups of people but vaccinations have been underway for months surely these and any demand peaks can be effectively managed and please consider the needs of the elderly and vulnerable in this process - given cohosting in progress.  
In addition consider providing updates as to ongoing time to wait which would be helpful especially for those who require medication at certain times and the wait is over an hour. Our experience today was of a poorly coordinated and managed process.  
However, have to positively highlight the nurse in the booth, receptionist and porters for their courtesy and kindness. Nurse Libby especially deserves a mention- my mum was chilled from waiting and Libby was person centred in her approach.

author: listenfq38
title: Courteous and thoughtful staff for Outpatient appointment
body:
Very clean, Polite staff  
All staff really courteous and thoughtful

title: S   L   O   W
body:
I asked for a blood test on 04/09 they gave me a video appointment on 06/09 . After waiting an hour and a half past my appointment time in a virtual waiting room and going beyond my lunch break allowance, they told i needed a blood test (which I already knew) and told me to wait for the practice to contact me.

On 09/09 I got an invitation to book a test. But told me I could not call them until 17/09 to book it.

When I called they gave me a test date of 06/10. I went in for the test and they told me they would be in touch if there was anything I needed to know.

I still haven't got my test results (18/10). I submitted another e consult to ask when I will find out and they've given me another video appointment.

A month and a half down the line and I am still waiting to find a reason for my never ending tiredness which is affecting my life in so many ways.

title: Outstanding
body:
I recently was feeling very sick.
The doctor did a thorough examination and asked a lot of important questions. 
My colour wasn't right but I didn't notice. 
They did and thanks to this surgery two lumps were found on my liver. 
The referral and the follow up from here was outstanding. 
Calling me out of hours to see my progress. 
Thank you so much!

author: phasedm65
title: Wonderful staff
body: I have been attending the urology department at North Devon District since 2013, originally for bladder cancer and now for prostrate cancer.  I cannot thank the staff, nurses and consultants enough they are truly wonderful.  I cannot speak highly enough of them and the care I receive.  They get on with the job but you can have a little laugh with them also.  I felt obliged to thank them for their continued commitment and care.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Speedy flu jab
body: Friendly people, speedy service at surgery’s special St Chad’s Church hall flu jab centre. No queue.

title: Thank you
body: Thank you for seeing me so promptly, diagnosing the problem correctly, e-mailing the prescription direct to the local pharmacy, which enabled me to pick it up straight away and start to take it as soon as I returned home. It helped within hours and I was able to reduce it under the doctor's directions the next day, and all pain had gone within 6 days.

title: Excellent service
body: I visited the critical care unit and ca1 ward a few times this past two weeks, to visit my father. I wanted them to know that they have been absolutely amazing. He was very sick and they did a brilliant job looking after him at a time when he needed it most, I feel my father is in the best care. The staff kept us up to date on his care through out, in what was an extremely worrying time for us- which made us feel cared for and reassured. They have been very informative,  friendly and professional throughout. My dad has been recovering well, and a big part of his recovery is down to an amazing team. Thank you very much.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Zero primary care
body:
It is virtually impossible to get through, unless you have dogged persistence and dial multiple times and then hang on for literally hours.

It IS impossible to get a face to face appointment.

I would like to know where all the money goes ;

The Longfield Surgery is essentially closed for any appointments.

The New Ash Green surgery, if you can get in there has often one or two GP’s, perhaps a nurse or two and often a single Receptionist.

Apparently 4 partner GP’s and 5 salaried Doctors work here - but where are they all ?

It was going downhill prior to COVID. However, it has hit rock bottom over the past 2 years and Covid has continued to be “the cause”.

In every other sector of the UK, businesses have had to adapt and improve.

That is not the case with this community service.

Just where is all the money going ?

author: the girl everyone knew
title: Told they had no more appointments left
body:
I have been contacted by my GP surgery on Thursday last week regarding my recent blood works, the doctor was going though my bloods and asking me questions which I was happy to answer. The doctor stated he had to call the hospital to find out what medication to provide me with and that he would call me back. This putting me incomplete panic as I didn’t know what was going on.  
The doctor eventually called me back and said he could give me a prescription but I would be referred to the hospital as a matter of urgency. He then told me if I get any worse symptoms or anything to call them back immediately.  
Since then on Sunday I have had constant bleeding and severe pain in my lower abdomen. I called my GP practice like I was advised to with any other issues, to be told they had no more appointments left I was to try again tomorrow. I called NHS24 for some advice to which they couldn’t help me either as my GP practice have a duty of care during the hours of 9-6. I have went on all day and all night with this severe pain and discomfort and no sleep for days, I have been feeling extremely down and depressed and this did not help the matter.  
This morning, I called the GP practice for another appointment. I waited on the phone for 40 minutes before someone eventually answered. I asked again for a doctor or a nurse appointment, to be told yet again they had no more appointments available try again tomorrow. I stated to the receptionist that I was advised by the doctor to call if any issue and I have phoned the past 2 days now. She advised there was nothing else she could do as they didn’t have appointments and were short staffed. The receptionist then advised to call NHS24 at 6pm when they close tonight. I understand that the NHS has a lot of strain and stress to deal with, but I’m a patient too. I might not have covid-19 symptoms but I am still not well with another condition. I totally understand they are short staffed but I still deserve the care and commitment from them.  
I don’t ever phone the doctors surgery, if I have anything wrong with me I get on with it. I have done that for the past year and now I have an over active thyroid that hasn’t been treated. I have so many questions that haven’t been answered, I have pain and discomfort that is being dismissed.  
I will try get through again tomorrow, but I have no hope.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Hard to contact
body: I have recently tried to get an appointment two days running. I know that you can only book a relatively urgent appointment by ringing up at 8am on the day. For two days running I tried for an hour to get through, only to get a message to say that the surgery was experiencing a high call volume so to try again later. I was not even put in a queuing system. When I did eventually get through I had missed any appointments for that day with the GP. On the second day I was offered a telephone consultation with the Pharmacist. I possibly have symptoms of a chest infection but it could also be Asthma, however I was  prescribed antibiotics without anyone listening to my chest. I cannot see a GP or go to the surgery as I have been told I have symptoms of COVID (a cough, however this is chronic and not new and furthermore I have had several negative lateral flow tests and been double jabbed and recently had a booster too). What is going on? It is nigh on impossible to see a GP. I understand the pressure the NHS is under, I am a health care practitioner leading a team who have been in the thick of it with COVID patients too. I do not often request a GP appointment, last time was around three years ago. I understand things will never go back to normal but I really feel that some things can only be diagnosed face to face, especially when we are also trying to cut back on antibiotic prescribing. Very disappointing

title: registration
body: My daughter has been in the process of trying to register with you since 29 September nearly three weeks ago. She has an urgent problem and needs to see a doctor. The receptionist keeps saying nothing she can do and send an e mail. How long will this take? and how can it be considered normal to have to wait so long for an appointment.

title: Very poor experince recently
body: Rang surgery 8am. After 26 attempts joined the phone queue. Waited in queue 30 mins, was then cut off. Tried again & eventually got through, but no phone apointments left for today. When i told receptionist I had already been in the queue but got cut off after 30 mins, she said “oh yes that does happen when a lot of people are trying to get through.” I was told to try again tomorrow, with no guarantee that I would have any better chance tomorrow and I really need antibiotics. Receptionist said there is a high demand for appointments. Why??? Its a shame that the service has gone downhill as I have been their patient for 37 years.

title: Pregnancy with GD & labour & post birth
body:
Thank you kings college hospital, I had the most amazing experience during my pregnancy and being diagnosed with GD. The care was superb and the midwives were amazing and supported me. 

I had a positive birth, again midwives were amazing, made me feel so calm and informed during labour.. thank you could not have asked for a more positive pregnancy & birth
